comment.narrative:
1.1 No Net Loss is a new concept for Sabah. 1.2 No State-level policies and regulations for generating revenues from innovative financing mechanisms and re-investing into Protected Areas and sustainable multiple-use forest landscape planning and management. 1.3 Limited capacities and experience of forest managers. 1.4 Law enforcement in the landscape is done by SFD and YS staff by means of mobile inspection and checkpoint at point of entry to the landscape. There are 60 law enforcement staff and patrolling is conducted on a daily basis. Of these 60, half have been awarded honorary wildlife warden status with powers of arrest. In 2010, there were less than five cases of fines. 1.5 The Sustainable Forest Management License Agreement (SFMLA) is applied.
2.1 No economic model has been developed to determine the optimal mix of land uses that maximizes sustainable use and conservation of landscape area 2.2. No landscape-level management plan 2.3 No pilot adaptive implementation of landscape-level management plan
3.1 No current environmental economic and financial analyses in Sabah for mixed land use that incorporates conservation criteria 3.2 No pilot implementation of revenue generating mechanisms in landscape areas 3.3 No current detailed operating & financial agreements 3.4 No existing financial accounting and monitoring of such agreements 3.5 No systems in place for allocation and re-injection of revenues 3.6 No tested and operational financial systems for benefit-sharing 3.7 No adaptive financial management in place

1.1 By 30 June 2019, “Managed Retention of Sabah’s Forests: Moving towards Biodiversity Net Gain Policy” is endorsed and approved by the State Government. 1.2 By 31 By June 2019, a new Ecosystem Conservation Fee Enactment in place. 1.3 By December 2019, a 30% increase in multiple-use landscape-level forestry, forest conservation and financial management capacities of SFD, NROS, SEPU, YS, DID, EPD. 1.4 By December 2019, a revised and updated set of regulations and guidelines for compliance monitoring and enforcement within a multiple use context that includes innovative revenue generating instruments. 1.5 As 1.3.
